links.title: 10 Stocks You Need to Banish Right Now
links.description: While there's only a modest degree of empirical evidence to support the whole "sell in May and go away" adage, this time around it might be wide advice to heed. The market remains unable to follow through on near-term bullish efforts, and despite a reasonably assuring beginning to the first quarter's earnings season, traders have largely responded to those reports in a bearish manner.

https://electrek.co/2018/04/24/tesla-model-x-crashes-walls-gym-driver-claims-sudden-acceleration/amp/

links.title: Tesla Model X crashes through two walls and ends up in a gym, driver claims it accelerated on its own
links.description: A Tesla Model X crashed through two separate walls to end up inside a gym in Florida last weekend. Fortunately, no one was injured, but now the driver of the Model X claims that the electric vehicle accelerated on its own.

links.title: MWS Street Smarts | Episode 9: Damage Control as Stocks Sell-off
links.description: 04/24/18 The markets are getting kicked in the teeth this Tuesday afternoon and it's a great day for Sarge & The Voz to roll up their sleeves and inject some damage control during this week's "Street Smarts." It's a risk-off day and both Stephen Guilfoyle and MWS' Olivia Voznenko are so hyped to discuss today's market sell-off that they can't even sit down.

links.title: Tesla: Will Investors Want to Buy Insurance on Its Bonds?
links.description: JPMorgan Chase (JPM) is trying to create a market in credit-default swaps tied to the bonds of Tesla ( TSLA). It's...sort of working? A JPMorgan trader has sent around quotes to see if clients are interested in buying or selling CDS referencing Tesla bonds, according to people with direct knowledge of the trading.

messages.body: $TSLA The Better Business Bureau is not real pleased with how the carmaker deals with customer complaints. https://stocknews.com/news/tsla-tesla-inc-tsla-gets-a-big-fat-f-for-resolving/

links.title: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Gets A Big Fat 'F' For Resolving Customer Complaints
links.description: The Better Business Bureau has offered up its assessment of how well Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) handles customer complaints. Let's just say that the carmaker has another item to add to its lengthy to-do list. CNET passes along the BBB's harsh assessment of Tesla.
